comment: Profe Arturo is an amazing professor. He made Spanish fun to learn. He does truly care and wants to see his students succeed. Something I really enjoyed about his class was how interactive the lectures were. He encouraged his students to practice their Spanish speaking skills which is important. If you have the chance to take this professor do it!

Prof Matute Castro is a great instructor. His class is alot of work but you will definitely improve by the end of the course. His class is very interactive and he will make you speak in spanish in class to him and your peers. There is alot of homework every week but exams are relatively straight forward. Highly recommend this professor!

This is my 2nd time taking Professor Matute Castro and he is by far one of my favorite professors at KSU. He is such a great teacher, he truly cares, and he makes the class fun. For my class we did have a lot of homework assignments but nothing too hard and as long as you were keeping up with that and participating in class its an easy A! Take him!

I took him for two of my spanish classes for my minor. If you can take him, TAKE HIM. He is such a sweet and kind person and one of the best professors I have ever had. Although there was a lot of homework (which is mandatory for any spanish class I think), I learned a lot and felt more confident in my spanish.

Professor Matute Castro is incredible. I am not a native speaker but I am still doing very well in his class. Weekly online quiz and 2 papers. One of the papers is a final research paper with a presentation but it is not too hard and he is not too tough of a grader. As long as you are trying and putting in effort you will be fine!
I am a native speaker. I loved his class. Attendance is important. He cares about his students. You have weekly assignments with on fridays.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Matute Castro is awesome, super caring, and funny. Fun class where you work with people around you but lots of presenting and projects. Strict on no phones out. Final was a partner project which I wish wasn't. Lots of HW due before the next day of class which isn't accepted late, but easy if you put in some effort.

Prof. Matute Castro is an amazing professor! He does grade in a tough way, but it is very helpful when you are trying to improve in a language. He was very helpful in explaining verb tenses which can be confusing at times for both native and non-native speakers.

Dr. Castro is amazing! You can tell he really cares, and teaches interesting topics. He left the final project super open, so I got to do my senior sem project on what really interested me. Very reasonable in expectations and timelines, and he cracks me up. A really good guy and professor

Great choice. He was always available for questions and was very understanding during this pandemic. The homework on Connect was pretty tolerable. He gave us three chances to take each exam on Connect. An A is definitely achievable.

Overall a great prof - available for questions, interactive class, plenty of opportunity to practice writing and verbal skills. Very patient when explaining concepts but treats you like an adult and expects commitment to the class. Only reason he doesn't get a 5 is that he tends to only give instructions for big projects 2-7 days before they're due

Professor Arturo is a great professor. Class is very interactive with him and partners. It's honestly not bad and I'd recommend anyone to take it. Just participate and get your stuff done and you should be fine.

Prof C was amazing! There are 3 essays, which he gives guidelines and lots of help to. Participation is key in this class,, be ready to speak Spanish! He is very funny and very welcoming. The textbook is needed because it is often used in class. He is always ready to help! There is no excuse to not make an A in this course.

Professor Arturo is great! He is a little demanding at times with what you should know, but the class is not hard at all. He is very helpful if you ask questions and is understanding and caring. There is a lot of homework online but it is also not hard at all. Overall, he was great!

Though he means well and is an extremely nice guy, he is an extremely challenging professor in regards to Spanish! He is a native so it is hard for him to convey things in English and is highly persistent in you asking things in Spanish. However, he provides options for you to better your grade through small extra credit and going to his office.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: Basically, if you are smart and good at Spanish, take a teacher that doesn't waste your time singing the alphabet/watching music videos. He treats everyone as if they have an IQ of 70. Notable language barrier that increases difficulty and he doesn't allow you to ask questions in English, which ruins the point of asking.

He is absolutely awesome!!! Low textbook use, many partner/small group learning activities, few things to hand in & grade, not the best at posting grades, no tests or quizzes. Extremely caring, intelligent, great instructor, energetic, funny, & most of all: YOU WILL SPEAK A LOT OF SPANISH! Take him, I promise you won't regret it! He is the BEST!!!
